intro: Navia gracilis, commonly known as slender navia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the family. Navia gracilis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
